description: The Royal Canadian Air Force\'s Non-Destructive Testing Centre has a requirement for a 3D imaging system to detect and locate voids, cracks, laminations in aircraft metal and composite structures.
full_summary:
## Government Tender Announcement

### W3474-230214 3D Imaging Systems

**Reference Number:** WS3766275361-Doc3766701884

**Solicitation Number:** WS3766275361

**Publication Date:** November 26, 2022

**Closing Date:** December 21, 2022, at 14:00:00

The Royal Canadian Air Force’s (RCAF) Non-Destructive Testing Centre requires a handheld, portable, self-contained ultrasonic high-resolution 3D imaging system to detect and locate voids, cracks, and laminations in aircraft metal and composite structures. The system must also measure remaining thickness of structural components in military aircraft.

The procurement includes the following UNSPSC codes:

* Viewing and observing instruments and accessories (41111700)
* Indicating and recording instruments (41111900)
* Mechanical instruments (41114500)

**Procurement Details**

* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
* **Contract Duration:** December 20, 2022 to March 31, 2025
* **Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **End-User Entity:** Department of National Defence (DND)

**Contact Information**

* **Judy Holt, PSPC/SPAC**
* **Email:** [judy.holt@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:judy.holt@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* **Notice URL:** [http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14741654?extsite=MTQ3NDE2NTRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14741654?extsite=MTQ3NDE2NTRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)

The contract will be delivered in Ontario, excluding the National Capital Region. The contractor must comply with the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).

This announcement is available in both English and French.
